title: Will Massachusetts pass a major economic development bill by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Massachusetts Legislature passes a major economic development bill. A 'major' economic development bill is defined as legislation that includes at least $500 million in funding or introduces significant policy changes aimed at stimulating economic growth in the state. The bill must be passed by both chambers of the Massachusetts Legislature and signed into law by the governor. If no such bill is passed and signed into law by the specified date, or if only minor economic measures are passed that do not meet the $500 million threshold or lack significant policy changes, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Jimmy Carter attend a public event celebrating his 100th birthday by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirming that Jimmy Carter personally attended a public event celebrating his 100th birthday. The event could be a musical gala, a ceremony, or any other public celebration specifically honoring Carter's centennial. If no such event occurs, if Carter does not attend for any reason (including health concerns), or if there is no conclusive evidence of Carter's attendance at such an event by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

article_information.article_description: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. title: Will India finalize a significant loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India and Vietnam officially finalize and sign an agreement for a loan of at least $250 million specifically aimed at enhancing Vietnam's maritime security. The finalization must be confirmed by official statements from both governments or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The loan must be designated primarily for maritime security purposes. If no such agreement is reached or finalized by the resolution date, or if the loan amount is less than $250 million, or if the primary purpose of the loan is altered to exclude maritime security, the question will resolve as NO.

article_information.article_description: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. title: Will the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits exceed 250,000 in any week by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, for any week up to and including the last week of August 2024, the U.S. Department of Labor reports that the number of initial jobless claims (seasonally adjusted) exceeds 250,000. The official weekly report from the U.S. Department of Labor will be used as the authoritative source for this data. This threshold is chosen as it represents a significant increase from recent historical averages, potentially indicating a shift in labor market conditions. If no such week occurs before the end of August 2024, or if the U.S. Department of Labor discontinues or significantly changes its method of reporting initial jobless claims, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the U.S. DOT ban airlines from charging fees for family seating by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) officially implements a rule that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for parents to sit with their children aged 13 or younger on flights. The rule must be formally adopted and published in the Federal Register. The implementation date of the rule does not need to occur before the resolution date, but the rule must be officially adopted by the DOT by August 31, 2024. If the rule is not officially adopted by this date, or if the proposal is significantly altered to remove the ban on such charges, the question will resolve as NO. This question is based on ongoing efforts by the DOT to improve family seating policies in air travel.

title: Will there be a mass protest in Nigeria resulting in at least one fatality by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is at least one mass protest in Nigeria that results in at least one fatality. A 'mass protest' is defined as a public demonstration involving at least 1,000 participants. The fatality must be directly related to the protest, either as a result of actions by security forces or other circumstances during the event. The incident must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as AP, Reuters, BBC, or Al Jazeera). If no such protest occurs or if no fatalities are reported in connection with any protests by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note: This question is based on the potential for civil unrest due to economic challenges in Nigeria.

title: Will the U.S. Congress pass a bipartisan tax package expanding the child tax credit by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Congress passes a bipartisan tax package that includes an expansion of the child tax credit. For resolution: 1. The package must be approved by both the House of Representatives and the Senate. 2. It must explicitly include provisions to expand the child tax credit for families. 3. The passage must be reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The question will resolve as NO if: - No such package is passed by the specified date, or - A package is passed but does not include an expansion of the child tax credit. Note: This question is based on the current political landscape and ongoing discussions about tax reform and family benefits. Any significant changes to the political makeup of Congress or shifts in policy priorities may influence the outcome but will not affect the resolution criteria of this question.

title: Will the NHTSA conclude its investigation into a Tesla 'Full Self-Driving' system crash by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) officially concludes and publicly releases its findings from an investigation into a crash involving a Tesla operating on its 'Full Self-Driving' system that resulted in a fatality. The conclusion of the investigation must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, or Fox News) and include a summary of the NHTSA's findings regarding the role of the 'Full Self-Driving' system in the accident. If the NHTSA has not concluded its investigation or has not publicly released its findings by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.
